page.title: 03HOUSING IN LANGCLIFFE (2)
page.content:
Number 2, St John's Row is one of a terrace of cottages which stand behind the Wesleyan chapel. They were built over a hundred years ago for the workers in the mill, which was then a cotton mill but now makes paper. The houses have two storeys and dormer-windowed attics. The original sash windows have been replaced with aluminium framed double glazing which, strangely, does not look at all out of place. They also have slate roofs and attractive stone fronts.
Houses here are much sought after by retired couples and families wanting a second home. As a result, the prices tend to be rather higher than in other parts of the Dales.
